Definition at line 609 of file LinearRegression.cpp.

References bvecM, and update().

void LinearRegression::leaveOneOut ( const Array< double > &  x,
const Array< double > &  y,
Array< double > &  yout 
)

Temporarily removes the vector pair(s) "x"/"y" from the regression model and uses this modified model to approximate the vector(s) "y", when the vector(s) "x" is/are given.

This method can be used to check if some vector pairs are necessary as information for the training of the regression model or not.
After the call of this method, the regression model is reset to the further state, where the pair(s) were included in the model.

Parameters:
x The x-vector(s) that will be temporarily removed from the model.
y The corresponding y-vector(s) that will be temporarily removed from the model.
yout The y-vector(s) for the given vector(s) x, approximated by the modified model.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x and y are not one- and 2-dimensional or that one of both is one-dimensional and the other one 2-dimensional or that the number of vectors in x is different to that in y
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
Examples:
linearRegression_test.cpp.

Definition at line 528 of file LinearRegression.cpp.

void LinearRegression::recall ( const Array< double > &  x,
Array< double > &  y 
)

Given one/several data vector(s) "x" the corresponding vector(s) "y" is/are calculated by using the current regression model.

The current regression model is used to approximate for one/several given data vector(s) .

Parameters:
x Input vector(s) for which the corresponding y-vector(s) will be calculated.
y The corresponding (approximated) y-vector(s) for the input vector(s).
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x is not one- or 2-dimensional or that the model was not calculated for any training vector yet
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes

Definition at line 450 of file LinearRegression.cpp.

void LinearRegression::remove ( const Array< double > &  x,
const Array< double > &  y 
)

Removes the data vector pair(s) "x"/"y" from the regression model.

Given the data vector and its corresponding , the internal variables from which the model is calculated are changed, i.e. the information given by and is removed from these variables.
You can also remove several x/y-vector-pairs at once.
The model itself is not changed here, it will changed after calling method update.
This separation is more efficient, e.g. when you are removing several data vectors at different time, because the model itself is then calculated only once after all vectors are removed instead of each time after a single vector pair is removed.

Parameters:
x Vector(s) containing the first component of the data.
y Vector(s) containing the second component of the data.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x and y are not one- and 2-dimensional or that one of both is one-dimensional and the other one 2-dimensional or that the number of vectors in x is different to that in y or that the model was not calculated yet or that it was not calculated for as many vectors as there are vectors in x and y
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
update

void LinearRegression::train ( const Array< double > &  x,
const Array< double > &  y 
)

Adds the data vector pair(s) "x"/"y" to the regression model.

Given the data vector and its corresponding , the internal variables from which the model is calculated are changed, i.e. the information given by and is added to these variables.
You can also add several x/y-vector-pairs at once.
The model itself is not changed here, it will changed after calling method update.
This separation is more efficient, e.g. when you are adding several data vectors at different time, because the model itself is then calculated only once after all vectors are added instead of each time after a single vector pair is added.

Parameters:
x Vector(s) containing the first component of the data.
y Vector(s) containing the second component of the data.
Returns:
none
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x and y are not one- and 2-dimensional or that one of both is one-dimensional and the other one 2-dimensional or that the number of vectors in x is different to that in y
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
update
Examples:
linearRegression_test.cpp.

Definition at line 245 of file LinearRegression.cpp.

void LinearRegression::update (  ) 

Calculates the current regression model.

Based on internal variables the current regression model is calculated if these internal variables have changed before due to adding/removing vector pair(s). This method is called automatically when you are calling the methods for returning the regression coefficients or or when you are calling the mehod for approximating an for a given (methods A, b, recall), so you can be sure that always the most current model is used.

Returns:
none
Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
train, remove, A, b, recall
